description: From Old French citer, from Latin citare (“to cause to move, excite, summon”), frequentative of ciēre (“to rouse, excite, call”).

verbs.description: cite (third-person singular simple present cites, present participle citing, simple past and past participle cited)

entries.meaning: to quote; to repeat, as a passage from a book, or the words of another.
to list the source(s) from which one took information, words or literary or verbal context.
to summon officially or authoritatively to appear in court.

description: From the first syllable of citation. Analogous to quote, from quotation.

examples: We used the number of cites as a rough measure of the significance of each published paper.
